body: third-party/protobuf has already support tvos now

I have been trying to add tvOS to gRPC-Core, but because it relies on BoringSSL, I also had to add tvOS support to BoringSSL. However, I can't get to test it. `pod spec lint` cannot work for gRPC-Core as it relies on changes on BoringSSL upstream. So instead, I'm using a spare Podfile of this shape:

```ruby
pod 'BoringSSL', :path => 'grpc/src/objective-c/BoringSSL.podspec'
pod 'gRPC-Core', :path => 'grpc/gRPC-Core.podspec'
pod 'SwiftGRPC', :path => 'grpc-swift/SwiftGRPC.podspec'
```

to make sure gRPC-Core uses the edited podspec of BoringSSL that supports tvOS, but BoringSSL fails to build at the `ss.prepare_command` trying to write the umbrella files with

```
/bin/bash: line 3: include/openssl/umbrella.h: No such file or directory
```

Anyone else working on this?

@Allezxandre thanks for working on this. If you just changed podspec but not any of the source files, you can use `:podspec` instead of `path`. Also, the part after `=>` is directory, not podspec file. So it should be something like `grpc/src/objective-c`
Let us know if you meet any other problem and we would love to help.

@Allezxandre were you able to solve it? I am also having the same issue, when I try to run 
`pod lib lint BoringSSL.podspec` it fails here `Add a module map and an umbrella header
cat > include/openssl/umbrella.h <<EOF ... `

Do you have a version of gRPC that supports tvOS?

Unfortunately I didn’t, I got too many issues and definitely not enough knowledge to fix them so I gave up. 

I ended up going back to integrating the framework in Xcode manually for tvOS projects. I needed to comment out every ˋfork()` instructions as they are not supported on tvOS

1.  I got BoringSSL from https://github.com/google/boringssl. 
2. Inserted podspec from https://github.com/CocoaPods/Specs/blob/9543734012238c33ea018af5a4381459c13f0916/Specs/0/8/a/BoringSSL/10.0.6/BoringSSL.podspec.json.
3.  Set support tvos in podspec. 
4.  After that cocoapod compile my pods successfule.

but while compilation whole project, I got compilation error: 

```
Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
  "_GRPC_SHADOW_SSL_get_secure_renegotiation_support", referenced from:
      bssl::ssl_check_clienthello_tlsext(bssl::SSL_HANDSHAKE*) in t1_lib.o
ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
```
gRPC is using pod `BoringSSL-GRPC` rather than `BoringSSL`

@muxi ok, thanks, I'll try connecting BoringSSL-GPRC. Currently, I have an issue on pods compilation as @Allezxandre 

```
Add a module map and an umbrella header cat > include/openssl/umbrella.h <<EOF ...
```

@muxi Yes, your advice helped. Now cocoapods installed successfully with next params:

```
  pod 'BoringSSL-GRPC', :podspec => 'grpc/src/objective-c'
  pod 'gRPC-Core', :podspec => 'grpc'
  pod 'SwiftGRPC', :podspec => 'grpc-swift'
```

Now I have that error: 
```
In file included from Pods/BoringSSL-GRPC/crypto/fipsmodule/cipher/e_aes.c:67:
Pods/BoringSSL-GRPC/include/openssl/arm_arch.h:96:5: error: "unsupported ARM architecture"
#   error "unsupported ARM architecture"
    ^
```

**UPD**

```
// Even when building for 32-bit ARM, support for aarch64 crypto instructions
// will be included.
```
Does It look like we want any instructions for arch x86_64?
Continue researching...

I am not familiar with tvOS, but I assume the devices themselves are some flavor of ARM and the simulator is x86_64. Given you are even getting to that file, it seems unlikely that x86_64 is involved here.

I would suggest figuring out what flavor of ARM it is and looking into why it's not being detected by arm_arch.h.
Not sure if this is of any help, but 3rd gen apple tv is `ARMv7` and newer ones are `ARMv8-a`

Sorry for missing last communications.

@bimawa - I agree with @davidben that it looks like the architecture is not correctly detected here, but are you targeting a simulator or an actual device? I find it's weird that `arm_arch.h` is used (which usually means you are targeting an ARM device, hopefully a tvOS device) and at the same time `__ARM_ARCH__` and `__aarch64__` are not defined (see ref below). I wonder what exactly is the device being targeted.

Ref to related part of `arm_arch.h`:
```
#if !defined(__ARM_ARCH__)
  #if defined(__CC_ARM)
    #define __ARM_ARCH__ __TARGET_ARCH_ARM
    #if defined(__BIG_ENDIAN)
      #define __ARMEB__
    #else
      #define __ARMEL__
    #endif
  #elif defined(__GNUC__)
    #if defined(__aarch64__)
      #define __ARM_ARCH__ 8
      #if __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__
        #define __ARMEB__
      #else
        #define __ARMEL__
      #endif
      // Why doesn't gcc define __ARM_ARCH__? Instead it defines
      // bunch of below macros. See all_architectires[] table in
      // gcc/config/arm/arm.c. On a side note it defines
      // __ARMEL__/__ARMEB__ for little-/big-endian.
    #elif defined(__ARM_ARCH)
      #define __ARM_ARCH__ __ARM_ARCH
    #elif defined(__ARM_ARCH_8A__)
      #define __ARM_ARCH__ 8
    #elif defined(__ARM_ARCH_7__) || defined(__ARM_ARCH_7A__) || \
        defined(__ARM_ARCH_7R__) || defined(__ARM_ARCH_7M__) ||  \
        defined(__ARM_ARCH_7EM__)
      #define __ARM_ARCH__ 7
    #elif defined(__ARM_ARCH_6__) || defined(__ARM_ARCH_6J__) || \
        defined(__ARM_ARCH_6K__) || defined(__ARM_ARCH_6M__) ||  \
        defined(__ARM_ARCH_6Z__) || defined(__ARM_ARCH_6ZK__) || \
        defined(__ARM_ARCH_6T2__)
      #define __ARM_ARCH__ 6
    #elif defined(__ARM_ARCH_5__) || defined(__ARM_ARCH_5T__) || \
        defined(__ARM_ARCH_5E__) || defined(__ARM_ARCH_5TE__) || \
        defined(__ARM_ARCH_5TEJ__)
      #define __ARM_ARCH__ 5
    #elif defined(__ARM_ARCH_4__) || defined(__ARM_ARCH_4T__)
      #define __ARM_ARCH__ 4
    #else
      #error "unsupported ARM architecture"
    #endif
  #endif
#endif
```
@muxi / @bimawa we are trying to build for the simulator first, any of these produce the same result (targeting tvos 10+):

If it's the simulator, I assume that means you are trying to compile for x86_64. In that case you should look into why arm_arch.h is getting pulled in, because it should only be pulled in on ARM.

We build BoringSSL for the iOS simulator fine in Chromium, so I'm guessing there is something funny about how you are building it.

@davidben @muxi @AVVS 
Guys thanks for your advice, I tried to reproduce the same error but after the update all of dependence source codes and manipulation with code in sources I compiled it successfully for x86-64 and for arm64 too. 
So my worked podfile below:
```
#Test grpc for tv-os
pod 'gRPC-Core', :git => 'git@github.com:bimawa/grpc.git', :branch => 'feature/supportTVOS'
pod 'BoringSSL-GRPC', :podspec => 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bimawa/boringssl/feature/supportTVOS/BoringSSL-GRPC.podspec'
pod 'SwiftGRPC', :git => 'git@github.com:bimawa/grpc-swift.git', :branch => 'feature/supportTVOS'
pod 'SwiftProtobuf', :git => 'git@github.com:bimawa/swift-protobuf.git', :branch => 'feature/supportTVOS'
```
And also updated all repos in my forks. Pls. check it, and correct. Maybe can we do something with it for support tvos in swift-gRPC

NOTE: for BoringSSL-GRPC I use `Podspec` only. Because sources don't work with others libs together
@bimawa Thanks! Will do.

@bimawa have you submitted individual PR's to fix each of those dependencies you listed? 

Getting grpc working for tvos is also blocking [Firebase on tvos](https://github.com/firebase/firebase-ios-sdk/issues/10)

@bimawa @jlaws - yep. Priorities has not been given to this unfortunately. If it's only podspec change for BoringSSL but not code change, we would be glad to review a PR and push it to next release for now.

@muxi I do some PR's. But... 
Where can I save 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bimawa/boringssl/feature/supportTVOS/BoringSSL-GRPC.podspec'
file for our grpc library?

And I don't sure about Apple lib  apple/swift-protobuf#833 so I wanna help to do it correctly.

Thanks for the PRs.

>Where can I save 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bimawa/boringssl/feature/supportTVOS/BoringSSL-GRPC.podspec'
file for our grpc library?

The podspec that gets uploaded is in [src/objective-c](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/tree/master/src/objective-c), but in gRPC it is generated from a template: [template/src/objective-c/BoringSSL-GRPC.podspec.template](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/templates/src/objective-c/BoringSSL-GRPC.podspec.template).

@muxi in my BoringSSL podspec `prepare_command` has different body script. I think it's very important. Because I spent a lot of hours to find this worked version. How can we check it? Just I haven't skilled enough to check this body.
And second question, how can I compile templates for check it too?

`prepare_command` section is also in the template ([here](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/templates/src/objective-c/BoringSSL-GRPC.podspec.template#L153)). You can overwrite it.

Files are generated from templates with `$ tools/buildgen/generate_projects.sh`. I just ran it once for you in the PR you made.

Ok, guys, @muxi merged it into master. Until Release you have to use 

```
  pod 'BoringSSL-GRPC', :podspec => 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bimawa/boringssl/feature/supportTVOS/BoringSSL-GRPC.podspec'
```

and for swift-grpc:

```
  pod 'SwiftGRPC', :git => 'git@github.com:bimawa/grpc-swift.git', :branch => 'feature/supportTVOS'
```

After release, we will merge this podspecs too.

This thread saved my day! 
There are any chances on having this released anytime soon?

Thanks!
This should be available in 1.19.0 released a few days back.
@muxi if you have some spare time, could you please help with vendoring libs in https://github.com/grpc/grpc-swift/pull/358
